summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about radical generosity! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredible sermon challenging Impact Church to understand the true meaning of giving. PT breaks down how generosity is more than just money - it's love in action. Did you catch how he emphasized that what you love, you give to? Just like God loved the world so much that He GAVE His only Son, we're called to give sacrificially. Pastor Travis shared an incredible vision of Impact Church expanding across the valley, with a bold $6 million project to launch a second campus in South Scottdale. The most inspiring part? A couple in the church willing to match up to $2.5 million in donations! PT challenged us to move from 'lip service to life service', revealing that our bank statements are actually 'theological statements' that show what we truly love. He powerfully illustrated this through the stories of Mary (who poured out a year's wages worth of expensive perfume on Jesus' feet) and Judas (who was more concerned about money). The sermon wasn't just about giving money, but about giving our entire lives to God. Pastor Travis's passionate plea was clear: God is calling us to be radically generous, not just with our finances, but with our entire being.

versesMentioned.text: And now, brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the grace that God has given the Macedonian churches. In the midst of a very severe trial, their overflowing joy and their extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity. For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own, they urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in this service to the Lord's people. And they exceeded our expectations: They gave themselves first of all to the Lord, and then by the will of God also to us.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
No one can serve two masters. Either you will hate the one and love the other, or you will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.

Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me. But you ask, 'How do we rob you?' In tithes and offerings. You are under a curse—your whole nation—because you are robbing me. Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,' says the Lord Almighty, 'and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.'
A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.

Eat the tithe of your grain, new wine and olive oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.

Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously. Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

Monday.scripture: Malachi 3:10: 'Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,' says the Lord Almighty, 'and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.'
Monday.action: Review your monthly budget. Identify areas where you can reduce spending and increase giving. Pray about what percentage of your income God is calling you to give.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal my heart's true priorities. Help me to be a cheerful and generous giver, trusting You with my finances and believing in Your promise of blessing.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 9:7: 'Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.'
Tuesday.action: Find a way to give today that isn't monetary - give your time, attention, or a meaningful act of service to someone in need.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, teach me to give not out of obligation, but out of love. Help me see giving as a joyful act of worship.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:9-10: 'Honor the Lord with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops; then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.'
Wednesday.action: Before paying any bills this month, set aside your tithe first. Trust God with the remainder and watch how He provides.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I want to honor You first in my finances. Give me faith to trust You completely with my resources.

Thursday.scripture: Luke 6:38: 'Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.'
Thursday.action: Look for an opportunity to give generously today - whether financially, through service, or with encouragement.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, expand my understanding of generosity. Help me give without expecting anything in return, trusting in Your economy of blessing.

Friday.scripture: Acts 20:35: 'In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.''
Friday.action: Anonymously bless someone today - pay for someone's coffee, leave an encouraging note, or help someone without seeking recognition.
Friday.prayer: Father, teach me the joy of giving without recognition. Help me find fulfillment in serving others as You would.

Saturday.scripture: Matthew 6:21: 'For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer asking God to reveal where your true treasures are. Be honest about your attachments and ask for a heart realignment.
Saturday.prayer: God, search my heart. Show me where my true treasures lie and help me to invest in eternal things that truly matter.
